title: Black Pepper Beef
description: A wok-seared black pepper beef with tender strips of marinated sirloin, crisp onions and bell peppers, finished in a savory soy-based sauce with a bold cracked black pepper kick. Quick to cook and piled over steamed rice or noodles for a satisfying weeknight dinner.

ingredients.display_name: sirloin steak, thinly sliced against the grain

steps.text: Prepare the beef by slicing thinly against the grain and place in a bowl; add cornstarch, 2 tbsp soy sauce and Shaoxing wine, toss to coat and let sit while you prep vegetables.
Mix the sauce in a small bowl with remaining soy sauce, oyster sauce (if using), brown sugar, stock and dark soy (if using); set aside.

Heat a large wok or heavy skillet over high heat until smoking slightly, add 1 tbsp vegetable oil and spread; sear beef in a single layer in two quick batches without overcrowding until just browned but not fully cooked, about 45-60 seconds per side, then remove to a plate.
Add remaining 2 tbsp oil to the wok, reduce heat to medium-high, add minced garlic and ginger and stir-fry until aromatic, about 30 seconds.
Add sliced onion and bell peppers, stir-fry until edges begin to char and vegetables are tender-crisp, about 2-3 minutes.

Return the seared beef and any accumulated juices to the wok, sprinkle in the freshly cracked black pepper, pour the prepared sauce over, and toss to combine; cook until sauce thickens and beef is cooked through, about 2 minutes.
If sauce needs gloss, stir a small slurry of cornstarch and water into the wok to thicken for 30-60 seconds; finish with a drizzle of toasted sesame oil and toss with sliced green onions.
Taste and adjust seasoning with extra soy or cracked pepper as desired, then serve immediately over steamed rice or noodles.
